comments.author: Tofu Mom
comments.content:
Ahhh... this is for MY birthday, right? I'll act all surprised and everything, promise.

No, seriously, I have EVERYTHINg to make this without having to shop (tomatoes, corn and squash from the garden - though I may use yellow patty-pan instead since I have those coming out my ears).

DEFINITELY will be making it soon. The tomato olive oil sounds divine!

Can I still review the recipe if I don't do it exactly as written (i.e. no cheese)? Cause I'd LOVE to do that!!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Tofu Mom - you can definitely review the recipe even if you make changes. There is a place on the form where you can say what you did differently. Much appreciated!

comments.author: Buttered Lips
comments.content: This sound fantastic and I'm going to make it this weekend. YUM YUM YUM I haven't seen the Seitenbacher powder you mention. Any ideas where to buy in the Seattle/Olympia area?

comments.author: Sara
comments.content: Best birthday dinner I've had all year! Thank you - it was perfect.

comments.author: Karen
comments.content: Just made this. It was AMAZING. Especially the tomato oil - such a great part. Thanks!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Hey Karen - I'm so glad you liked it, and I appreciate you letting me know.
It is funny that you mention it, because I did that post last summer and I
plan to make a tomato and corn risotto tomorrow night! This one will be a
little different, so if it turns out well I'll post it too.

Thanks,
Michael
